title: Write Ch 12 — The Closer
description: Replace the placeholder comment in Ch 12 (the-closer) of ithaca-chapters.json with final copy. Update, build, deploy.

title: Phase 1: Scaffolding — JourneyLayout, Chapter component, placeholder page
description: Create feat/travel-ithaca branch. Build JourneyLayout.astro extending BaseLayout. Create Chapter.astro (full-viewport wrapper). Create ithaca.astro page with 3 placeholder chapters. Add /travel/ nav link to Header.astro. Create travel/index.astro placeholder. VERIFY: dev server runs, /travel/ithaca renders 3 colored sections, scrolling works, header/footer present, no mobile overflow.
close_reason: All verification criteria pass: build succeeds, 3 chapters render, header/footer present, Travel nav link added, no mobile overflow.

title: Phase 3b: Generate AI vibe images (2-3 images)
description: Generate images per the AI-Generated Vibe Images spec in the design doc. Image 1 (Ch 1 hero): misty gorge at dawn, painterly, NOT photorealistic. Image 2 (optional, Ch 5): deadpan generic hotel exterior at magic hour. Image 3 (optional, Ch 12): abstract water/light/mist texture for low-opacity background. Record in ithaca-credits.json as AI-generated.

title: Phase 3c: Image pipeline + ImageHero component
description: Add sharp as devDependency. Create scripts/process-images.mjs: resize to 600w/1200w/1920w, convert to WebP (q80) + AVIF (q70), extract dominant color placeholders, output manifest JSON. Build ImageHero.astro with <picture>, srcset, gradient overlay, lazy loading, credit line. Add hero support to Chapter.astro. Implement parallax (60% scroll speed). Implement chapter crossfade transitions. Add AI image grain overlay CSS. VERIFY: responsive images served, AVIF/WebP selection works, gradient overlays legible, parallax smooth, AI images show grain, credits visible, lazy loading works, Lighthouse Performance > 90, page weight < 5MB.
close_reason: Implemented via Astro built-in Picture component instead of custom sharp pipeline. ImageHero.astro, responsive srcset (600/1200/1920w), AVIF+WebP, gradient overlays, credits, AI grain overlay, desktop-only CSS parallax, BeforeAfter slider wired with real images.

title: Phase 3a: Source CC/public domain photography (8-10 images)
description: Source images per the Asset Sourcing Specification in the design doc. Target: Mohawk Trail Hairpin Turn, Bridge of Flowers, Taughannock Falls (hero + before/after pair), waterfall thumbnails, Ganondagan longhouse, Sapsucker Woods, Quechee Gorge or VT bridge. Search Wikimedia Commons, Unsplash, Flickr CC in that priority order. Record attribution in ithaca-credits.json. All images must have CC-BY, CC-BY-SA, or equivalent license.
close_reason: Downloaded 8 CC-licensed photos from Wikimedia Commons with full attribution in ithaca-credits.json. All images verified valid.

title: Phase 2: Route Map — SVG path, scroll animation, responsive sidebar
description: Trace SVG route path (Hooksett→Mohawk Trail→Ithaca→Vermont→home), simplify to 200-300 points. Create ithaca-route.svg and ithaca-route.json. Build RouteMap.astro: fixed 60px left sidebar (desktop), 4px top progress bar (mobile). Implement stroke-dashoffset scroll animation via CSS animation-timeline: scroll(). Pin markers with hover/tap labels. Integrate into JourneyLayout. VERIFY: map draws proportionally on scroll, pins appear at correct thresholds, mobile collapses to top bar, @supports fallback shows full map, prefers-reduced-motion shows full map.
close_reason: All verification criteria pass: scroll-driven map animation, pin reveals, desktop sidebar, mobile progress bar, @supports fallback, prefers-reduced-motion support.

title: Build reusable components for research pages
description: Create Astro components for rendering travel research content: ScoreCard (8-dimension radar/bar display), ComparisonTable (sortable destination scoring matrix), TierList (tiered recommendation lists with icons), ItineraryDay (day-by-day itinerary blocks), DestinationCard (card linking to individual destination page with key stats), MethodologyNote (callout explaining AI research process). All vanilla CSS, no client-side JS.

title: Publish Summer 2026 Travel Research
description: Add 5 new destination pages + comparison landing to gnarlybob.net from the summer 2026 travel research corpus in .scratchpad/summer-2026-travel-research/. Ithaca references the existing /travel/ithaca slideshow. See .scratchpad/summer-2026-travel-research/summer-2026-document-manifest.md for full corpus structure.

title: Add writing/blog section with Astro content collections
close_reason: Implemented in feat/add-writing-blog branch, PR #7. Content collection with glob loader, post layout with prose typography, listing page, dynamic routes, header nav link. Build and type check pass.

title: Quebec City destination page (template)
description: Build /travel/summer-2026/quebec-city/ as the first destination page, establishing the pattern for remaining destinations. Quebec City scored highest (8.8 composite) and has the richest consensus report (5 models, 606 lines). This page becomes the template that the other 4 destinations follow. Content source: quebec-city-consensus-report.md. Key sections: overview/highlights, recommended itinerary, photography guide, dining, culture/Indigenous heritage, logistics, source quality notes.

title: Update travel hub and site navigation
description: Update /travel/ index to feature the Summer 2026 research section prominently. Add navigation links from the travel hub to /travel/summer-2026/. Ensure the existing Ithaca journey link coexists with the new summer 2026 section. Consider adding breadcrumb or back-navigation from destination pages.

title: Build remaining 4 destination pages
description: Following the Quebec City template, build pages for: Saguenay (8.4), Riviere-du-Loup (8.1), Moncton (8.0), Algonquin (6.8). Each at /travel/summer-2026/{slug}/. Content from respective consensus reports. Ithaca (7.9) doesn't get a new page — it links to existing /travel/ithaca slideshow.

title: Summer 2026 comparison landing page
description: Build /travel/summer-2026/ as the capstone overview page. Content from summer-2026-destination-comparison.md. Features: 6-destination scoring matrix (8 dimensions), tier rankings (Tier 1: Quebec/Saguenay/Moncton, Tier 2: RdL/Ithaca, Tier 3: Algonquin), head-to-head comparisons, recommendation callouts, links to all 6 destination pages. Ithaca card links to /travel/ithaca/ (existing), others link to /travel/summer-2026/{slug}/.

title: Waterfall cards: replace side-scroll with responsive grid
Phase 5a: Waterfall field guide cards (Ch 7)
description: Build WaterfallCard.astro per component spec. Populate ithaca-waterfalls.json with 10 entries from consensus report tiers. Source thumbnail images, process through pipeline. Horizontal scroll container with scroll-snap. Integrate into Ch 7. VERIFY: cards scroll horizontally with snap, mobile shows scrollbar, all data matches consensus report, thumbnails load correctly.

Files: ithaca-finger-lakes-consensus-report.md, moncton-consensus-report.md, quebec-city-consensus-report.md, saguenay-lac-saint-jean-consensus-report.md, algonquin-provincial-park-consensus-report.md, riviere-du-loup-consensus-report.md.

title: Fix orphan words in centered text (text-wrap: balance/pretty)
Create travel research layout and CSS theme
description: Create a ResearchLayout.astro for long-form travel research pages. Distinct from JourneyLayout (scroll-driven narrative) — this is for structured reference content with tables, tiered lists, scoring cards, itineraries. Needs: warm/muted color palette (research tone vs cyberpunk HUD), responsive typography with clamp(), table styling, callout boxes, tier badges, and a sidebar or sticky nav for long documents. Add journey-research.css alongside existing journey.css.

title: Phase 5b: Restaurant cards (Ch 10)
description: Build RestaurantCard.astro per component spec. Populate ithaca-restaurants.json with 7 entries from consensus report. 2-column grid (desktop), 1-column stack (mobile). Integrate into Ch 10. VERIFY: grid renders correctly at all breakpoints, data matches consensus report.
close_reason: 7 restaurant cards, 2-col grid desktop / 1-col mobile, all data matches spec

title: Remove remaining back-coddling refs in waterfall cards
Phase 6: Polish & Performance
description: Typography fine-tuning across breakpoints (320/375/768/1024/1440px). Transition timing and easing. Image loading sequence (Ch 1 eager, rest lazy). OG meta tags + OG image (1200x630). Accessibility audit: alt text, focus states, prefers-reduced-motion, semantic HTML, contrast > 4.5:1, keyboard nav. Complete image credits section at page bottom. VERIFY: Lighthouse Performance > 90, Accessibility > 95, Best Practices > 95. Page weight < 5MB. FCP < 1.5s. CLS < 0.1. Full read-through on mobile 375px and desktop 1440px.
close_reason: OG meta, credits section, grain overlay, semantic HTML, 256KB page weight, 0 type errors. Images pending 3a/3b.

title: Phase 4: Content & Copy — all 12 chapters
description: Fetch writing style from https://gist.github.com/bitspace/59c0d4a85561aa3c9874c6bb138d5d46 and write all chapter copy per the Chapter-by-Chapter Content Specification in the design doc. Populate ithaca-chapters.json. Build each chapter layout (text positioning, alignment). Implement text fade-in via animation-timeline: view(). Add Fraunces font (self-hosted woff2, preload). Leave Ch 12 as <!-- AUTHOR: Write the closer. --> placeholder. VERIFY: full scroll reads as coherent narrative, typography renders correctly, fade-ins trigger correctly, prefers-reduced-motion shows all text, no overflow on any viewport, contrast > 4.5:1.
close_reason: All 12 chapters with copy, Fraunces self-hosted, fade-in animations, fallbacks. Ch 12 placeholder for author.
